text: Florence May Chadwick (November 9, 1918 - March 15, 1995Susan Ware, Notable American Women: A Biographical Dictionary Completing the Twentieth Century (Cambridge, MA: Belknap Press, 2004), p. 110) was an American swimmer. She was known for long-distance swimming. At age 10 she was the first child to swim the Catalina Channel.Paula Edelson, A to Z of American Women in Sports (New York: Facts on File, 2002), p. 38 Chadwick was the first woman to swim the English Channel in both directions. She set a time record each time. She was the first woman to swim the Straits of Gibraltar, the Bosporus (one way), and the Dardanelles (round trip). == References == Category:American swimmers Category:1918 births Category:1995 deaths Category:Sportspeople from San Diego
title: Florence Chadwick
